quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.
context: Said to Frodo in the Mines of Moria, comforting him after Frodo wishes the Ring had never come to him.

quote: Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.
context: Said to Frodo in Lothlórien, reinforcing the theme of unlikely heroes.

quote: There is some good in this world, and it's worth fighting for.
context: Said to Frodo in Ithilien, encouraging him to continue their journey to Mount Doom.

quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
context: Written by Bilbo in a poem about Aragorn in *The Fellowship of the Ring*.

quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.
context: Said to Frodo in the Shire after Frodo expresses fear about his journey.

quote: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
context: Said to Elrond during the Council at Rivendell, pledging loyalty to the Fellowship.

quote: The world is indeed full of peril, and in it there are many dark places; but still there is much that is fair.
context: Spoken to the Fellowship upon their arrival in Lothlórien.

quote: Deeds will not be less valiant because they are unpraised.
context: Said in defense of small and unnoticed acts of heroism, often attributed to his sense of quiet nobility.

quote: It is not the strength of the body, but the strength of the spirit.
context: From Tolkien’s letters, reflecting on the theme of inner fortitude over brute power.

quote: The wide world is all about you: you can fence yourselves in, but you cannot forever fence it out.
context: To Frodo, hinting that danger and change are inevitable and must be faced.

quote: The burned hand teaches best. After that, advice about fire goes to the heart.
context: Said to Pippin in Minas Tirith, reminding him of the power of experience.

quote: I will not say: do not weep; for not all tears are an evil.
context: Said during the departure at the Grey Havens, acknowledging the bittersweetness of farewells.

quote: The pity of Bilbo may rule the fate of many.
context: Referring to Bilbo’s decision to spare Gollum’s life, which ultimately leads to the Ring’s destruction.

quote: A single dream is more powerful than a thousand realities.
context: A quote from Tolkien’s writings, reflecting his views on imagination and storytelling.

quote: The road goes ever on and on, down from the door where it began.
context: A walking song sung by Bilbo and later Frodo, symbolizing life’s journey and continuity.

quote: You step into the Road, and if you don't keep your feet, there is no knowing where you might be swept off to.
context: Bilbo’s reflection on the unpredictability of adventure, said in the Shire.

quote: There is no curse in Elvish, Entish, or the tongues of Men for this treachery.
context: Spoken after discovering the destruction of the forest near Isengard.

quote: Oft hope is born when all is forlorn.
context: Said in the face of overwhelming odds, emphasizing unexpected hope.

quote: The shadow that bred them can only mock, it cannot make: not real new things of its own.
context: From his letters, reflecting on the nature of evil as corruption, not creation.

quote: A day may come when the courage of men fails… but it is not this day.
context: Rallying the troops before the Battle at the Black Gate.

quote: I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.
context: Said to Sam in Mount Doom after the Ring is destroyed.

quote: Go not to the Elves for counsel, for they will say both no and yes.
context: Humorous wisdom about the Elves’ often cryptic guidance.

quote: May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.
context: Said to Frodo when giving him the Phial of Galadriel in Lothlórien.

quote: I would rather spend one lifetime with you than face all the ages of this world alone.
context: Arwen’s declaration of love for Aragorn in *The Fellowship of the Ring* (film adaptation).

quote: In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit.
context: The iconic opening line of *The Hobbit*, symbolizing humble beginnings.

quote: He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom.
context: Said to Saruman, criticizing his destructive thirst for knowledge.

quote: The board is set, the pieces are moving. We come to it at last—the great battle of our time.
context: Said before the Battle of Minas Tirith in the film adaptation.

quote: The old that is strong does not wither.
context: From a poem describing Aragorn’s lineage and inner strength.

quote: It’s the job that’s never started as takes longest to finish.
context: Sam quoting his Gaffer, a bit of rustic hobbit wisdom.

quote: Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger.
context: Said to Frodo when advising caution about powerful beings.
